metadata.title: CVE-2018-19887 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An invalid memory address dereference was discovered in the huffcodefunction (libfaac/huff2.c) in Freeware Advanced Audio Coder (FAAC)1.29.9.2. The vulnerability causes a segmentation fault and applicationcrash, which leads to denial of service in the book 4 case.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19887` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

faac - 1.30-1
libfaac0 - 1.30-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: faac package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.30-1').
